fields.value: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS):  Institutional Characteristics, 1989-1990

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This collection offers data on basic characteristics of   postsecondary institutions in the United States and covers   institutional characteristics for 1989-1990. The data were used for   sample design and selection for other IPEDS surveys. Key data elements   include the name, address, and telephone number of the institution as   well as information about levels of course offerings, calendar system,   admissions requirements, student services, accreditation, modes of   instruction, and institutional eligibility for student financial aid   programs. Updated information on tuition and fees and room and board   charges for the current academic year also is available. The unit of  analysis is the postsecondary institution.

topicClassValue.value: IDRC VI. Human Dimension of International Relations

fields.value: Version Date: 1999-04-26Version Text: 1999-04-26Version Date: 1999-04-26Version Text: 1999-04-26 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: The data file and corresponding codebook have been  replaced with updated versions from NCES. Blanks (in columns 794-1000)  have been eliminated from the data file and the new codebook is more  complete and has been reordered. The survey instrument for total  institutional activity in 1988-1989, erroneously included in the  previous version of the codebook, has been removed. Also, the codebook  has been converted to a PDF file and SAS data definition statements have been prepared.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS data definition statements;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) The file consists of data derived from three  distinct survey instruments. (2) The codebook and data collection  instruments are provided as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The  PDF file format was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be  accessed using PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat  Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the Internet.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

value: All postsecondary institutions in operation in 1989-1990  in the United States, the District of Columbia, and outlying  territories (American Samoa, Guam, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands,  and the Marshall Islands) and Department of Defense schools outside the United States.
